descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course is to develop an understanding of human behavior in changing organizations. It examines the tools and the methods to increase effectiveness. It will examine principles and theories about individuals and groups at work, and apply them to the realities of the workplace.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
1. Give students an understanding how people's behavior in an organization is affected by the external and internal environment.
2. Learn how organizations function.
3. Learn how people function in organizations.
4. Give students an understanding of how to manage oneself.
5. Give students an understanding of how to manage others.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Classes will be interactive with students bringing in examples from their own workplace. There will be some lecture, but mostly class discussion, looking at what is currently happening in today's organizations. There will be in class groups and team projects. There will also be films, writing assignments, and a research project.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Reaction papers, research project and class attendance and participation.
